instructions.1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
instructions.2: Peel butternut squash with a sharp vegetable peeler. Cut in half lengthwise; scoop out and discard seeds.
instructions.3: Cut halves into 1-inch slices, then cut slices into 1-inch cubes.
instructions.4: Combine butternut squash cubes, olive oil, and garlic in a large bowl and toss until well coated. Season with salt and pepper.
instructions.5: Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet.
instructions.6: Roast in the preheated oven until squash is lightly browned and tender when pierced with a fork, 25 to 35 minutes.
